meanings.definition: To turn over pages in a book or document.
meanings.sent1: She was folioing through the pages of her favorite novel.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys folioing through old photo albums to reminisce.
meanings.sent3: The cat was folioing the pages of the magazine, looking for pictures of mice.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was folioing through memories like a well-worn book.
meanings.sent5: The sound of folioing pages echoed in the quiet library.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing or arranging pages in a specific order.
meanings.sent1: The folioing of the documents made it easier to find what we needed.
meanings.sent2: His meticulous folioing of the files impressed his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The folioing of the papers on his desk resembled a neat puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her folioing of the recipe cards created a perfect cooking system.
meanings.sent5: The folioing of the notes into sections helped her study effectively.
